textline.text: AARON ROUSSELL, PhD
Washington State University
Department of Criminal Justice and Criminology
Johnson Tower 722, Pullman, WA 99164-4872
a.roussell at wsu.edu
EDUCATION
2007 – 2013 PhD, University of California, Irvine (UCI), Criminology, Law & Society (CLS)
2005 – 2007 MA, University of Wyoming (UW), Sociology
1999 – 2003 BA, College of William & Mary (W&M), Sociology, Music
RESEARCH AND TEACHING POSITIONS
Assistant professor (graduate faculty): Washington State University, Pullman
(WSU), Department of Criminal Justice and Criminology (CJC)
Instructor/Teaching Assistant: UCI, CLS
2005 – 2013 Research consultant: National Drug Court Institute (NDCI)
2005 – 2007 Research consultant: Wyoming Department of Health, Substance Abuse Division
Instructor/Teaching Assistant: University of Wyoming, Department of Sociology
RESEARCH AND TEACHING INTERESTS
Racial capitalism; urban sociology; drug policy and addiction; police and governmentality;
sociology of law; critical race theory; structural crime correlates
PUBLICATIONS
*(indicates alphabetical ordering, equal author contribution)
Journal Articles
Roussell, A. (Accepted.) Policing the anticommunity: Race, deterritorialization, and labor market
reorganization in South Los Angeles. Law & Society Review, 49, 4.
Roussell, A., & Gascón, L.D. (2014). Defining “policeability”: Cooperation, control, and
resistance in South Los Angeles community police meetings. Social Problems, 61, 2,
Hipp, J.R., & Roussell, A. (2013). Micro- and macro-environment population and the
consequences for crime rates. Social Forces, 92, 563-595.
Lynch, M., Omori, M.K.*, Roussell, A.*, & Valasik, M.A. (2013). Policing the “progressive”
city: The racialized geography of drug law enforcement. Theoretical Criminology, 17,
Roussell, A., Holmes, M.D., & Anderson-Sprecher, R. (2013). Community characteristics and
methamphetamine use in a rural state: An analysis of preincarceration usage by prison
inmates. Crime & Delinquency, 59, 1036-1063.
Roussell, A. (2012). The forensic identification of marijuana: Suspicion, moral danger, and the
creation of non-psychoactive THC. Albany Law Journal of Science and Technology, 22,
-Reprinted in Kelly, J. (2013). Beat marijuana charges without plea bargaining.
Ronkonkoma, NY: Linus Publishing.
Freng, A., Davis, T., McCord, K., & Roussell, A. (2012). The new American gang? Gangs in
Indian country. Journal of Contemporary Criminal Justice, 28, 446-464.
Heck, C., Roussell, A., & Culhane, S. (2009). Assessing the effects of the drug court intervention
on offender criminal trajectories: A research note. Criminal Justice Policy Review, 20,
Heck, C. & Roussell, A. (2007). State administration of drug courts: Exploring issues of
authority, funding, and legitimacy. Criminal Justice Policy Review, 18, 418-433.
-Reprinted in Barton-Bellessa, S.M., & Hanser, R.D. (Eds.). (2011). Community-based
corrections: A text/reader (pp 84-95). Los Angeles: Sage Publications.
Work in Progress
Gascón, L.D., & Roussell, A. Policing communities: Race, crime, and social control in the
age of colorblindness. Under advance contract at NYU Press.
Roussell, A. & Gascón, L.D. Exercise in failure: Boot camp and the youth control complex.
Revise and resubmit at Law & Social Inquiry.
Roussell, A.,* & Omori, M.K.* Normalizing desistance: Contextualizing marijuana and cocaine
use careers in young adults. Under review at Sociology of Health and Illness.
Roussell, A. & Dunbar, J. Paradise lost: White flight, broken windows, and the construction of a
criminogenic origin myth. To be submitted to The Politics of Policing: Between Force
and Legitimacy, Deflem, M. (Ed.), Emerald. In progress.
Routh, D.R., & Roussell, A. Police as therapists? Resituating the role of law enforcement. In
progress.
Other Publications (Book Chapters, Commentary, Technical Reports, etc.)
Roussell, A., Cortright, C., Posey, B. & Foster, C. (2015). Holmes et al v. City of Racine: Expert
witness report. U.S. District Court for the Eastern District of Wisconsin. 14-CV-208-JPS.
Roussell, A. (2013). Re/Presenting the community: Power, race, and division in South LA’s
community policing program. Technical report/grant deliverable for the Haynes
Foundation of Los Angeles.
Fortin, V.* & Roussell, A.* (2012). “Just the facts”: Student occupations, police repression, and
“protest management” in California. The Critical Criminologist, 21, 1, 8-14. (Invited
commentary).
Hipp, J.R., Tita, G.E., Gascón, L.D.*, & Roussell, A.* (2010). Ethnically transforming
neighborhoods and violent crime among and between African-Americans and Latinos: A
study of south Los Angeles. Technical report/grant deliverable for the Haynes Foundation
of Los Angeles. Available at https://webfiles.uci.edu/hippj/johnhipp/publications.html
-Roussell, A., & Gascón, L.D. Chapter 2: Murder booked: Exploring inter- and
intraracial homicide in South Los Angeles (pp. 24-45.).
-Roussell, A., & Gascón, L.D. Chapter 4: “It’s amazing the microscope they put on it”:
Civilian interviews and observations in 77th Area and Watts (pp. 51-67).
-Gascón, L.D., & Roussell, A. Chapter 5: Policing conflict: Police interviews and
observations regarding interracial violence in South Los Angeles (pp. 68-82).
Omori, M.K.,* Reyes, W.,* Roussell, A.,* Valasik, M.,* Diggs, R., & Lynch, M. (2010).
Policing in the “progressive” city: Racial disparities in San Francisco drug arrests.
Technical report for the American Civil Liberties Union of Northern California.
Hipp, J.R., & Roussell, A. (2010). Solomon Kobrin. In F.T. Cullen & P. Wilcox (eds.),
Encyclopedia of criminological theory. Thousand Oaks, CA: Sage.
Heck, C. & Roussell, A. (2007). Record keeping and statistics. In J.E. Lessenger & G.F. Roper
(Eds.), Drug courts: A new approach to treatment and rehabilitation (pp. 401-413). New
York: Springer-Verlag.
Roussell, A. & Heck, C. (2007). Meth ecology: Examining social disorganization and
methamphetamine use in Wyoming. Technical report for the State of Wyoming,
Department of Health, Substance Abuse Division.
Heck, C., Thanner, M.H., & Roussell, A. (2006). Evaluating Wyoming’s drug courts: A model
for process evaluation. Technical report for the State of Wyoming, Department of Health,
Substance Abuse Division.
Huddleston, C.W., Freeman-Wilson, K., Marlowe, D.B., & Roussell, A. (2005). Painting the
current picture: A national report card on drug courts and other problem solving courts,
I, 2. Alexandria, VA: National Drug Court Institute, Bureau of Justice Assistance.
AWARDS
Outstanding Graduate Faculty Mentor Award, 2014, CJC, WSU
Arnold Binder Award for outstanding departmental service by a graduate student, 2011, CLS,
UCI
Gilbert Geis Award for excellence in graduate research, 2009, CLS, UCI
Best Oral Presentation, 2007, Graduate Research Symposium, UW
GRANTS, FELLOWSHIPS, AND GRADUATE SUPPORT
Expert witness, Holmes v. City of Racine, 2015, ($4,000 support for graduate assistance)
Faculty Seed Grant (applied), 2015, WSU, ($27,523)
International Travel Grant, Spring 2015, College of Arts & Sciences, WSU ($1000)
Lindley Doctoral Dissertation Fellowship, 2012-2013, The John Randolph Haynes Foundation
Graduate Dean’s Dissertation Fellowship, Fall 2012, Graduate Division, UCI ($10,000)
Law and Society Association Graduate Student Travel Grant, Honolulu, HI, June 5-8, 2012
Professional Development Fellowship, Fall 2010, CLS, UCI ($10,170)
Visualizing Governing through Crime in California, 2009, UC Berkeley and UCI, with Luis D.
Gascón ($500)
Center for Organizational Research Small Grant, 2009, School of Social Ecology, UCI ($500)
James Monroe Scholar, 1999, W&M
CONFERENCE AND SYMPOSIA PRESENTATIONS
Omori, M.K., & Roussell, A. Postbellum pharmacology: New dimensions of drug regulation
after the US war on drugs. Panel presentation at the Contemporary Drug Problems
Conference, Lisbon, Portugal, September 2015.
Roussell, A., & Gascón, L.D. Failure as strategic programming: Bootcamp and the youth
control complex. Panel presentation at the Law & Society Association, Seattle, WA, May
Roussell, A. & Dunbar, J. Paradise lost: White flight and the construction of a criminogenic
origin myth. Panel presentation at the American Society of Criminology, November
Routh, D.R., & Roussell, A. Police as therapists? Resituating the role of law enforcement. Panel
presentation at the American Society of Criminology, November 2014.
Roussell, A. Policing the anticommunity: Deterritorialization, race, and labor market
reorganization. Panel presentation at the American Sociological Association, San
Francisco, CA, August 2014.
Roussell, A. Geography, problem solving partnerships, and the “territorial imperative”: LAPD
defines community. Panel presentation at the American Society of Criminology, Atlanta,
GA, November 2013.
Omori, M.K. & Roussell, A. The slippery slope of addiction: Drug use trajectories over the
lifecourse. Panel presentation at the Contemporary Drug Problems Conference, Aarhus
University, Denmark, August 2013.
Roussell, A. Production by division: Anticommunity policing in South Los Angeles. Panel
presentation at the American Society of Criminology, Chicago, IL, November 2012.
Roussell, A., & Gascón, L.D. Contesting “policeability”: Cooperation, control, and resistance
in South Los Angeles community police meetings. Panel presentation at the American
Sociological Association, Denver, CO, August 2012.
Hipp, J.R., & Roussell, A. Micro- and macro-environment population and the consequences for
crime rates. Panel presentation at the American Sociological Association, Denver, CO,
August 2012.
Roussell, A., & Gascón, L.D. Cooperation, control, and resistance: Policeability, interaction,
and community policing in South Los Angeles. Panel presentation at the Law & Society
Association, Honolulu, HI, June 2012.
Gascón, L.D. & Roussell, A. Immigration, membership, and outreach: The challenges and
interventions of community policing in South Los Angeles. Presented at the Stockholm
Gang Intervention and Prevention Project, Stockholm, Sweden, May 2012.
Roussell, A., & Omori, M.K. Situating drug use over the lifecourse: Using empirical findings to
build theory. Panel presentation at the Western Society of Criminology, Vancouver, BC,
Canada, February 2011.
Gascón, L.D., & Roussell, A. Cooperation and control: Community policing in South Los
Angeles. Panel presentation at the American Society of Criminology, San Francisco, CA,
November 2010.
Lynch, M., Omori, M.K., Roussell, A., Valasik, M.A & Verma, A. (2010). Race, justice, and
reforming drug policy. Roundtable at the American Society of Criminology, San
Francisco, CA, November 2010.
Gascón, L.D., & Roussell, A. Visions of control: Crime, contexts, and the specter of community
policing. Visualizing Governing through Crime in California, Critical Legalities
Symposia series, Center for Law, Society, and Culture, UCI, May 2010.
Roussell, A. & Hipp, J.R. Exploring nowhere: Layers of density and rates of crime. Panel
presentation at the American Society of Criminology, Philadelphia, PA, November, 2009.
Gascón, L.D., & Roussell, A. Black, brown and blue: Converging discourses on racialized
violence in South Los Angeles. Panel presentation at the American Society of
Criminology, Philadelphia, PA, November 2009.
Roussell, A., Holmes, M.D., & Anderson-Sprecher, R. (2008). Community characteristics and
methamphetamine use in rural areas: A challenge to social disorganization theory?
Panel presentation at the American Society of Criminology, St. Louis, MO, November

Steward, Social Ecology, UCI

2011 – 2012 Diversity Committee: Student member, CLS, UCI
2010 – 2012 Graduate Student Comprehensive Exam Committee: Member, CLS, UCI
2008 – 2010 Colloquium Committee: Chair, CLS, UCI
McNair Scholars Program: Graduate mentor, Sociology, UW
